tourcalc package¶

tourcalc.cal_cat(age_select, dis_select)[source]¶

calculation of weight categories

Parameters

  • age_select – selected age caterogries [list]

  • dis_select – selected disciplines [list]

tourcalc.calculate_fight_time(dict_inp, final, tatami)[source]¶

calculate the fight time

Parameters

  • dict_inp – contains the number of athletes per category [dict]

  • tatami – number of competitaion areas [int]

  • final – does the event have a final block [bool]

tourcalc.changes_per_permutation(scheduled_jobs)[source]¶

calculates amount of discipline changes per permutation

tourcalc.descition_matrix(cat_time_dict, av_time, tatami, break_t, breaktime, breaklength)[source]¶

to find the best solution based on penalty and weighting of the resutls

Parameters

  • cat_time_dict – dictionary with catergories and time of eath catergory [dict]

  • av_time – reference time for average tatami [float] (sec)

  • tatami – number of tatamis [int]

tourcalc.distr_cat_alg(jobs, av_time, cur_per, cur_pen_time, tatami, break_t, breaktime, breaklength)[source]¶

Run the algorithm. Create List of dictionaries with, where each diszipline has its own dictionary. And fill it with the existing catergories Sort each disctiinary by size (longest competitions in beginning of list)

Parameters

  • jobs – dict of catergories that need to be distributed (dict)

  • av_time – reference time for average tatami (float [s])

  • cur_per – current order of disziplines [list]

  • DIS_CHA_TIME – pentaly time for changing a diszipline [fload [s]]

  • DIS_CHA – indicate change of diszipline [str]

  • tatami – number of tatamis [int]

  • break_type – “block” ; “Individual” [str]

tourcalc.heatmap(data, row_labels, col_labels, strtitle)[source]¶

Create a heatmap from a numpy array and two lists of labels. - HELPER FUNCTION DRAW

Parameters

  • data – A 2D pandes data frame array of shape (N, M). [df]

  • row_labels – A list or array of length N with the labels for the rows. [list]

  • col_labels – A list or array of length M with the labels for the columns. [list]

  • strtitle – A string that contains the tittle [string]

tourcalc.minloadtatami(loads)[source]¶

Find the tatami with the minimum load. Break the tie of tatamis having same load on first come first serve basis.

tourcalc.plot_schedule(scheduled_jobs, cat_time_dict, start_time, loads, endtime)[source]¶

plots a schedule

tourcalc.plot_schedule_go(scheduled_jobs, cat_time_dict, start_time, loads, endtime)[source]¶

plots a schedule
